fields.name: action
fields.comment: Action taken by the reporting device

fields.name: delay
fields.comment: Total sending delay in milliseconds

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The endpoint system to which the message was delivered

fields.name: duration
fields.comment: The amount of time for the completion of the messaging event, in seconds.

fields.name: file_hash
fields.comment: The hashes for the files attached to the message, if any exist.

fields.name: file_name
fields.comment: The names of the files attached to the message, if any exist.

fields.name: file_size
fields.comment: The size of the files attached the message, in bytes.

fields.name: internal_message_id
fields.comment: Host-specific unique message identifier (such as aid in sendmail, IMI in Domino, Internal-Message-ID in Exchange, and MID in Ironport).

fields.name: message_id
fields.comment: The globally-unique message identifier.

fields.name: message_info
fields.comment: Additional information about the message.

fields.name: orig_dest
fields.comment: The original destination host of the message. The message destination host can change when a message is relayed or bounced.

fields.name: orig_recipient
fields.comment: The original recipient of the message. The message recipient can change when the original email address is an alias and has to be resolved to the actual recipient.

fields.name: orig_src
fields.comment: The original source of the message.

fields.name: process
fields.comment: The name of the email executable that carries out the message transaction, such as sendmail, postfix, or the name of an email client.

fields.name: process_id
fields.comment: The numeric identifier of the process invoked to send the message.

fields.name: protocol
fields.comment: The email protocol involved, such as SMTP or RPC.

fields.name: recipient
fields.comment: A field listing individual recipient email addresses, such as recipient='foo@splunk.com', recipient='bar@splunk.com'

fields.name: recipient_count
fields.comment: The total number of intended message recipients.

fields.name: recipient_status
fields.comment: The recipient delivery status, if available.

fields.name: response_time
fields.comment: The amount of time it took to receive a response in the messaging event, in seconds.

fields.name: retries
fields.comment: The number of times that the message was automatically resent because it was bounced back, or a similar transmission error condition.

fields.name: return_addr
fields.comment: The return address for the message.

fields.name: size
fields.comment: The size of the message, in bytes.

fields.name: src
fields.comment: The system that sent the message. You can alias this from more specific fields, such as src_host, src_ip, or src_name.

fields.name: src_user
fields.comment: The email address of the message sender.

fields.name: status_code
fields.comment: The status code associated with the message.

fields.name: subject
fields.comment: The subject of the message.

fields.name: url
fields.comment: The URL associated with the message, if any.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user context for the process. This is not the email address for the sender. For that, look at the src_user field.

fields.name: vendor_product
fields.comment: The vendor and product of the email server used for the email transaction. This field can be automatically populated by vendor and product fields in your data.

fields.name: xdelay
fields.comment: Extended delay information for the message transaction. May contain details of all the delays from all the servers in the message transmission chain.

fields.name: xref
fields.comment: An external reference. Can contain message IDs or recipient addresses from related messages.

fields.name: filter_action
fields.comment: The status produced by the filter, such as 'accepted', 'rejected', or 'dropped'

fields.name: filter_score
fields.comment: Numeric indicator assigned to specific emails by an email filter

fields.name: signature
fields.comment: The name of the filter applied.

fields.name: signature_extra
fields.comment: Any additional information about the filter.

fields.name: signature_id
fields.comment: The id associated with the filter name.
